tweet: What we saw today was shocking to say the least. The Trump administration should be ashamed of #RemainInMexico and the #TentCourts. We must hold them accountable for this travesty & fight for migrant families to be treated with dignity and respect. #DemsAtTheBorder #DontLookAway pic.twitter.com/BcuZvoP6EM

This medical clinic just opened a few months ago. I asked about mental health services. Some are provided, but not nearly enough to deal with trauma, esp. for women & children. #DontLookAway #DemsAtBorder pic.twitter.com/8k4J11qRl4
Getting ready to cross the border to Matamoros. #DemsAtBorder #DontLookAway pic.twitter.com/O81iRgXEqd

Shameful and appalling that the Trump Administration is treating migrants and asylum seekers like this - #RemainInMexico is dangerous and the #TentCourts deny due process. We must hold @DHSgov and @CBP accountable for what we witness today. #DontLookAway #DemsAtTheBorder

Hearing the firsthand accounts of lawyers/advocates who have visited Matamoros MX tent camps, where 3k+ migrants wait in limbo & squalor. Today, #DemsAtBorder will bear witness to these inhumane conditions as a result of Trump’s cruel #RemainInMexico policy. #DontLookAway pic.twitter.com/zHftFNzmcK

The Memorial would be a visible symbol and reminder of the essential value journalists play in our democracy. Next step: a vote by the full House of Representatives. I urge all of my colleagues to support this critical legislation!

BREAKING NEWS! The House Natural Resources Committee just passed my bill, H.R. 3465, the Fallen Journalists Memorial Act. This bipartisan, bicameral legislation establishes a commemorative work in DC, honoring journalists, photographers & broadcasters killed in the line of duty.
I congratulate all of my colleagues on being named House managers, thank them for their service & patriotism, and fully support their efforts to protect the Constitution and #DefendOurDemocracy.

Last month the House impeached President Trump for abuse of power and obstruction of Congress. I have full confidence that my colleagues will continue to lay out the overwhelming evidence and ensure a fair impeachment trial in the Senate. https://twitter.com/speakerpelosi/status/1217464494668091394 …

2/3 of Americans want witnesses like John Bolton at the Senate impeachment trial. Senators will be accountable to the public if they turn the trial into a cover-up. #DefendOurDemocracy https://twitter.com/HeidiNBC/status/1216818094326370304 …

Today I will vote YES on the War Powers Resolution to direct the President to stop the use of military force in or against Iran & reassert that the sole power to declare war belongs to Congress. We cannot get involved in another endless war. #NoWarWithIran

During today’s hearing, @TransportDems will explore the role of resiliency for @USACEHQ projects, address project affordability for vulnerable urban and rural communities, and discuss how to maximize Army Corps technical expertise.

Local water resources projects are imperative to promoting resiliency, protecting our communities, addressing water infrastructure needs, and more, but without funding these projects won’t happen. That’s why today’s hearing is part of our plan to develop #WRDA2020.

We are kicking off 2020 with a hearing on the next Water Resources Development Act, vital legislation which authorizes Army Corps projects in Southern CA & across the US. Tune in now as we focus on #WRDA2020: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R90eVjDYTW4&feature=youtu.be …

One year ago, I was proud to cosponsor #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act, and to say #EnoughIsEnough. Our communities deserve to feel safer from gun violence. It’s time for Leader McConnell to put this bill up for a vote. #EndGunViolence pic.twitter.com/8ugVGl81W7
Tonight I am praying for our troops, our diplomats, and all U.S. personnel stationed in Iraq. I am also praying that this is not the start of another war.
